title: Kamben Geringsing (ceremonial Cloth), 1900–79
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave
description: Textile in weft ikat made to imitate double ikat 'geringsing' technique. Part of a grid in which (if complete) would be composed of square placement of circles in red, purple, and white. Shows "kota-mesir" pattern (four-pointed star, notched internal pattern, divides piece into semi-circular segments). Semi-circles depict "wayang patlikur isi" motif (small geometric take on wayang puppet) and other figures. Motifs typical of geringsing cloths, but has uncharacteristic red border on all sides. Fringed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Kamben Geringsing (ceremonial Cloth), 1900–79.Medium: silk
Technique: tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave. 1979-90-1.
